ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service

Class ForecastService

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.ForecastService

  • @Service
public class ForecastService
extends java.lang.Object
    This service class contains all main functionalities related to Forecasts.
    Author:
    Ilana Haddad

    • Method Detail

      • createForecast

        public ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.Forecast createForecast(java.lang.String name,
                                                               java.lang.String baseVersion,
                                                               int futureYear,
                                                               java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.dto.TreeDto> treesToPlant,
                                                               java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.Tree> treesToCutDown)
                                                        throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This method creates a forecast given a list of trees to plant and trees to cut down. It will create two new TreeManager's to add to the system: a forecast version, and a duplicate of the base version.
        Parameters:
        name - of person creating the forecast
        baseVersion - for forecast
        futureYear - year of future version
        treesToPlant - list of trees to plant in the new forecast version
        treesToCutDown - list of trees to cut down in the new forecast version
        Returns:
        Forecast created
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.InvalidInputException

      • baseIsForecast

        public boolean baseIsForecast(ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.TreeManager baseTM)
        This method checks if the base treeManager a forecast has been requested on is already a forecast. It checks this by checking if the decimal of the version number is anything other than 0. Our forecast versions all have X.1 or X.2, etc. A version that has X.0 is a base version and is not a forecast
        Parameters:
        baseTM - base TreeManager requested for forecast
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether the requested base is already a forecast

      • calculateDuplicateVersion

        public java.lang.String calculateDuplicateVersion(ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.TreeManager baseTM)
        This is a helper method that calculated the version number of the duplicate TreeManager For example, if a forecast on base 1.0 is requested, the duplicate version number is 2.0 This duplicate version is only created for the first forecast of a base. For example it is created if version 1.0 has no forecasts (e.g. when creating version 1.1, version 2.0 is created. but for version 1.2, since 2.0 already exists, it is not created again). this duplicate version is created in order to be the new system's version that is editable by everyone. If a forecast on version 1.0 is created, version 1.0 is no longer editable, so we make an exact copy of it, called 2.0 and that is the new version of the forecast.
        Parameters:
        baseTM -
        Returns:
        duplicate version number cast as a String

      • calculateForecastVersion

        public java.lang.String calculateForecastVersion(ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.TreeManager baseTM)
                                          throws ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.InvalidInputException
        This helper method calculates the version number for a forecast. For example, if baseTM version is 2.0, then the forecast version must be 2.1 In the event where 2.1, 2.2, 2.3 are already created, we must be creating the version 2.4, I calculate in this method what the highest forecast version is from 2.0 to 3.0 (not included) in order to determine the next verison number of the forecast.
        Parameters:
        baseTM -
        Returns:
        forecast version number cast as a String
        Throws:
        ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.service.InvalidInputException

      • copyAllContents

        public void copyAllContents(ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.TreeManager tmToCopy,
                            ca.mcgill.ecse321.TreePLE.model.TreeManager tmCopiedTo)
        This method copies all contents from one TreeManager to the next. This method is used when creating the new TreeManagers, they must all have the same base and then depending on whether is it a forecast or a duplicate, we can add datan to the copies of the TreeManagers
        Parameters:
        tmToCopy - TreeManager we want to copy all data of
        tmCopiedTo - empty TreeManager we want all data copied to
